txt.en:
'Will you help me? It's the most infuriating problem!

'We are trying to run water from the springs nearby to our encampment -- I want a hot bath! I don't think that's too much to ask, do you? Not in this unrelenting cold.

'Unfortunately, the great winter-worms have other ideas. Have you seen these creatures? Rather like furred drakelings, huge, heat-loving, cold-resistant, and very territorial. There are three water-channels in particular where they have disrupted our work. Please, in the name of steaming hot bathing-chambers everywhere, put a stop to this!

'You will find them north of here, where the water steams.'
'Ha hah! That'll teach 'em!\n\n'Delighted, my dear [placeholder], simply delighted with you, I must say. I'm one step closer to a long, hot soak. But there appears to be a bit more to do....'

'Right, I've had reports and figured out where the worst of the worm attacks are happening. They seem to be concentrated at three channels -- the fourth, seventh, and tenth.\n\n'Ridding us of the big worms at those channels would be worthwhile indeed -- then maybe you can have a nice hot bath too!'
Great winter-worms have been interrupting the dwarves' efforts to get hot water from nearby springs. Weth is most annoyed.
Defeated the great winter-worm at the fourth dwarf-channel
Defeated the great winter-worm at the seventh dwarf-channel
Defeated the great winter-worm at the tenth dwarf-channel
You have made a dent in the population of worms around the dwarf-channels Weth described to you. You should return to him at Zigilgund.
